item.title: Created to Have Joy
item.description: "God didn’t design us to be sad. He created us to have joy!" — Dieter F. Uchtdorf

item.title: Thank you from LDS Charities
item.description: LDS Charities believes we are better together. We would like to thank our donors, partners and volunteers for helping us improve lives around the globe, thank you for all that you do!

item.title: Sierra Leone—Building Wheelchairs
item.description: LDS Charities partners with local organizations to donate wheelchairs to those in need and also to teach local people how to build their own wheelchairs that can be donated to more remote locations in Sierra Leone.

item.title: Sierra Leone—Clean Water
item.description: LDS Charities partners with a Sierra Leone village to dig wells and provide clean water to hundreds of people who did not have access before.

item.title: Navajo Reservation—Garden Project
item.description: LDS Charities partners with local leaders to teach families how to garden and become more self-sufficient.

item.title: Bolivia—Container Garden Project
item.description: LDS Charities provides training and supplies for families in Bolivia to grow vegetables, improving their health and overall quality of life.

item.title: Rescuing Refugees in Kurdistan
item.description: Refugees from Mosul in Northern Iraq were given a place to live when two brothers gave up their houses to 23 families.

item.title: Always Something to Give – The Coconut Farmer
item.description: In November 2013, the strongest typhoon ever recorded slammed into the Philippines. The opportunities to help each other along created a beautiful silver lining around an otherwise terrible tragedy.

item.title: Serving the Community - Immunization Awareness
item.description: Providing so many people with vaccinations for deadly diseases like measles seems like an impossible task. That doesn’t stop Gaylene from doing her part in her community.

item.title: Helping Refugees in Iraq – The Mayor of Howesk
item.description: “We are not perfect, but we love helping others, because we know this is an emergency, and people in hard situations should show who they really are and be good to one another,” says the mayor.

item.title: Making a Difference to Orphans with HIV
item.description: Orphans is Romania received blood transfusions in the 1980s to make them stronger—but the blood was actually infected with HIV. Through the use of a single syringe, the virus was passed along from one child to another.

item.title: War in Sierra Leone – Saved from the Rebels
item.description: War devastated Sierra Leone for over 10 years. Rebels were killing civilians, civilians who weren’t killed had no food, and the road to freedom was blocked. Survivors Abie and Mohammad Turay are proof that God lives and loves His children.

item.title: Saving Children – Measles Vaccination
item.description: When she lost her baby boy to a preventable disease, Helen knew she had to do something to save others from similar tragedy.

item.title: Aids Clinic – Fighting for Others
item.description: In the 1980s, countless Romanian orphans were infected with the HIV virus through blood transfusions, vaccinations, and immunizations in hospitals. Dan was one of those orphans. Now a grown man, he was the only survivor among his friends.

item.title: 30 Million People Need Prosthetic Limbs
item.description: Her life changed at 15 years of age when—in front of her home in Santa Domingo—a car lost control and accidentally ran her over. This tragic car accident left Mayerlinth Reyes with a completely different state of life.

item.title: Kingsley Mamabolo—South Africa Ambassador to the United Nations
item.description: Kingsley Mamabolo talks about the relationship between South Africa and LDS Charities.

item.title: Leslie Goldman—U.S. Fund for UNICEF
item.description: Leslie Goldman talks about the relationship between the U.S. Fund for UNICEF and LDS Charities.

item.title: Libran Nuevas Cabactulan—Philippines Ambassador to the United Nations
item.description: Libran Nuevas Cabactulan talks about the relationship between the Philippines and LDS Charities.

item.title: What Family Means
item.description: The Davies bring new meaning to the phrase “one big, happy family.” With seven kids, Jim and Becky Davies’ family is bigger than they had dreamed it could be.

item.title: A Recipe For a Happy Family
item.description: Too many cooks in the kitchen? That is never a problem for the Chavez family. In fact, making a delicious meal elbow-to-elbow is their favorite way to spend time together.

item.title: Make It a Good Day
item.description: “I think being a mom is the most important job in the world—and I’m not joking,” says mother Clair Kenny, whose big family stars in the first episode of Mormon Channel’s brand new video series, “Happy Families.”

item.title: Reflections
item.description: When trials and tests come, how to you react? Do you become selfish and scared, or do you face the challenges with patience, faith, and love for others? How you react could change your life and the lives of those around you, for better or worse.

item.title: Funeral Service for Elder Richard G. Scott
item.description: The Funeral services for Elder Richard G. Scott of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles, held in the Tabernacle on Temple Square on Monday, September 28, 2015

item.title: The Gift – Daughters in My Kingdom
item.description: Sister Julie B. Beck, Relief Society General President, encourages all to read and study "Daughters In My Kingdom: The History and Work of Relief Society."

item.title: Help or Hinder
item.description: Does technology help or hinder your worship?

item.title: Connect to the Spirit of God
item.description: We need a special place of refuge where we can wean ourselves from the distractions of our electronic devices by unplugging them so we can connect to the Spirit of God.

item.title: Family Night
item.description: Share your #FamilyNight

item.title: Family Night
item.description: Share your #FamilyNight

item.title: Help or Hinder
item.description: Does technology help or hinder your worship?

item.title: Connect to the Spirit of God
item.description: We need a special place of refuge where we can wean ourselves from the distractions of our electronic devices by unplugging them so we can connect to the Spirit of God.

item.title: What Is Addiction?
item.description: When you are addicted to a substance or behavior, your brain sends out unhealthy signals, making you believe that something harmful is okay because it makes you feel good for a time.

item.title: What Is Addiction Recovery?
item.description: What should you do if you or a loved one needs help overcoming an addiction? It takes a lot of courage to admit when you need help, but recovery is possible and definitely worth it.

item.title: Why Is It so Hard to Quit?
item.description: Addiction changes the way your brain works and affects your ability to control impulses. That is one of the reasons quitting can seem so impossible.

item.title: Adolescent Addiction
item.description: Did you know 95 percent of people addicted to substances started using before they were 20 years old?

item.title: Addiction Is Treatable
item.description: If you were diagnosed with a serious disease, wouldn’t you immediately seek treatment from experts? To overcome the disease of addiction, most people need treatment too.

item.title: Rationalization and Addiction
item.description: There are countless ways to justify the use of unhealthy substances and behaviors. This constant negative reinforcement allows addiction to continue.

item.title: Three-Legged Stool
item.description: It takes time and effort to recover from addiction—there is no quick fix. In order to make a full recovery, your mind, body, and spirit each need changing and healing.

item.title: Landscape of the Mind
item.description: Dr. Kevin McCauley turns complex neuroscientific concepts into easy-to-understand visual images that will help people in recovery feel better understood and their families and friends feel hope that recovery is possible.

item.title: What I Know Now - DJ
item.description: DJ shares a letter she wrote to her younger self about her loved ones addiction.

item.title: Like A Watered Garden
item.description: September 13, 2015: Elder L. Whitney Clayton urges us to seek the abundant life Christ offers all who are rooted in Him.

item.title: Guided Safely Home
item.description: We live in a world full of conflict, and we will sink without a sense of direction. Jesus Christ provides that direction, and living His teachings will steer us safely home. What will you do to reach up and obtain heavenly help today?
